data.title: John Galsworthy Works Complete 20 Volumes Heron Books ca1970
data.meta_description: John Galsworthy (1867-1933) devoted virtually his entire professional career to creating a fictional but entirely representative family of propertied
data.text:
Description

John Galsworthy Works Complete 20 Volumes

John Galsworthy (1867-1933) devoted virtually his entire professional career to creating a fictional but entirely representative family of propertied Victorians- the Forsytes. He made their lives and times- loves and losses- fortunes and deaths so real that readers accused him of including as characters in his drama real individuals whom they knew. He was the winner of the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1932.

This great collection comprises;

Forsyte Saga: illustrated by Christopher W.Bradbury

The Man Of Property, Indian Summer Of A Forsyte: 312 pp

In Chancery, Awakening, To Let; 471 pp

Forsyte Saga: A Modern Comedy illustrated by Christopher W.Bradbury

The White Monkey, A Silent Wooing, The Silver Spoon & Passers By; 479 pp

Swan Song; 257 pp

Forsyte Saga: End Of The Chapter illustrated by Christopher W.Bradbury

Maid In Waiting; 315 pp

Flowering Wilderness; 252 pp

Over The River; 291 pp

On Forsyte Change, illustrated by Christopher W.Bradbury; 292 pp

Novels:

The Dark Flower & Fraternity, illustrated by Sandra Archibald; 420 pp

The Country House, illustrated by Robert Bates; 198 pp

The Patrician illustrated by David Knight; 352 pp

Caravan I; 257 pp }

Caravan II; 317 pp } illustrated by David W.Whitfield

Caravan III; 300 pp }

Saints Progress, illustrated by Peter Whiteman ; 353 pp

The Inn Of Tranquility, illustrated by Peter Whiteman; 315 pp

The Freelands, illustrated by Denis Manton; 369 pp

Beyond, illustrated by Patrica Ludlow ; 366 pp

The Burning Spear; Villa Rubein, illustrated by Sandra Archibald; 341 pp

The Island Pharisees, illustrated by Patrica Ludlow; 290 pp

Features;

Publisher Heron Books, London; Undated ca.1970

Grey/Green Hardback with Gilt Titles and Decoration

Superbly Illustrated Throughout

Size 200 x 120mm, 10kg

Condition: Very Good – No Inscriptions, Very Good Rarely Seen Complete Collection
